value.title: What this bald eagle and neural network depiction have to do with future U.S. AI strategy
value.excerpt: The White House launched the National AI Initiatives Office, an org with an eagle and neural network on its seal, to plan U.S. AI strategy.

value.title: Job Screening Service Halts Facial Analysis of Applicants
value.excerpt: HireVue, a leading provider of software for vetting job candidates based on an algorithmic assessment, said Tuesday it is killing off a controversial feature of its software: analyzing a person’s facial expressions in a video to discern certain characteristics.

value.title: The best tech of CES 2021
value.excerpt: In order to find the best products from CES 2021, we met with manufacturers big and small for in-depth briefings, compared these gadgets to our top tested picks in terms of specs and features and, in some cases,

value.title: AWS Expands Its AI-Powered Contact Center Intelligence (CCI)
value.excerpt: Amazon Web Services is enabling customers to leverage its artificial intelligence capabilities with their current contact center providers.

value.title: All hail your new robot vac overlord: iRobot Roomba i3+ is here
value.excerpt: They’ve dusted down the iRobot robot vac range and added the Roomba i3+ which looks and performs a treat iRobot has taken the dust covers off its brand new model, the Roomba i3+. This manufacturer is known for producing some of the best robot vacuum cleaners money can buy and the latest addition to the Roomba robot vacuum lineup comes packed with new features.

value.title: The Weather Company Raises GPU, Storage Forecasts
value.excerpt: For those who follow supercomputing, weather forecasting is one area to watch for systems that are designed for maximum capability. Unlike the many other

value.title: KPMG’s Marisa Ferrara Boston embraces auditing disruption with Watson
value.excerpt: “We understand that audit is going to be disrupted,” says Marisa Ferrara Boston, the Automation and AI Lead Architect at KPMG, one of the world’s top providers of auditing services. Marisa is clear-eyed about the seismic shifts that her industry faces, but she is hopeful that with preparation, these

value.title: CES 2021: Asus Republic of Gamers unveils Flow X13 convertible gaming laptop with external GPU
value.excerpt: The new 13-inch gaming PC converts between a laptop and tablet via a 360-degree hinge and gets a performance boost from an external GPU.

value.title: Containment algorithms won’t stop super-intelligent AI, scientists warn
value.excerpt: Computer scientists used theoretical calculations to show it would be impossible to build an algorithm that could control super-intelligent machines.

value.title: Google trained a trillion-parameter AI language model
value.excerpt: They’re the part of the model that’s learned from historical training data. Generally speaking, in the language domain, the correlation between the number of parameters and sophistication has held up remarkably well.

value.title: Startup Opportunities In AI – The Unbundling Of Search

value.title: Trump admin launches National AI Initiative Office
value.excerpt: The White House today announced the launch of its National AI Initiative Office, marking what should be President Trump‘s final manipulation of the country’s gutted Office of Science and Technology Policy (OSTP).

value.title: How the use of robotics is evolving at MRFs
value.excerpt: A recycling facility operator and a robotics company say artificial intelligence is providing materials recovery firms with much-needed data to analyze changes in the recycling stream. That’s in addition to sortation improvements.

value.title: NVIDIA Unveils GeForce RTX 30 Series Laptops And The Aggressively-Priced GeForce RTX 3060 Desktop GPU At CES
value.excerpt: PC Graphics giant, NVIDIA today has taken the wraps off new GeForce RTX 30 Series gaming laptop platform technologies, as well as a new GeForce RTX 3060 graphics card that will address the meat of the market at a popular $329 midrange price band.

value.title: Business Contracts Remain Complex, And Artificial Intelligence Can Improve Contract Management
value.excerpt: Contracts are one of the most complex things to understand and analyze in the business world. Artificial intelligence can help in contract analysis and management, and is starting to be applied in the real world.

value.title: Roboflow raises $2.1M for its end-to-end computer vision platform
value.excerpt: Roboflow, a startup that aims to simplify the process of building computer vision models, today announced that it has raised a $2.1 million seed round co-led by Lachy Groom and Craft Ventures. Additional investors include Segment co-founder Calvin French-Owen,

value.title: Dishwashing robots and Bluetooth masks: Pandemic products hit tech's biggest show
value.excerpt: Companies big and small showed off their new innovations at the closely watched tech trade show, which kicked off on Monday, many with features tied to life during the pandemic.

value.title: FDA Releases Artificial Intelligence/Machine Learning Action Plan

value.title: U.S. Fintech Artis Announces New Bank Funding Partneship With Drummond Community Bank
value.excerpt: Artis Technologies, a U.S.-based fintech that provides lending solutions for businesses, announced on Tuesday it has entered into a new bank funding partnership with Drummond Community Bank for its Artis Credit platform.

value.title: South Korea Mulls Investing $114 Billion in AI Chips

value.title: Who Is Mr. Blue Eyes In ‘Cyberpunk 2077,’ Part Of Its Sprawling Rogue AI Unsolved Mystery?
value.excerpt: This past week, the senior quest designer of Cyberpunk 2077 said that even after millions of hours of gameplay in the past month, not all of the game’s secrets have been uncovered yet. Mr. Blue Eyes may be one of them.

value.title: A new technique called ‘concept whitening’ promises to provide neural network interpretability
value.excerpt: "Concept whitening" can help steer neural networks toward learning specific concepts without sacrificing performance.

value.title: A Startup Will Nix Algorithms Built on Ill-Gotten Facial Data
value.excerpt: San Francisco face-recognition startup Everalbum won a $2 million contract with the Air Force to provide “AI-driven access control.” Monday, another arm of the US government dealt the company a setback.

value.title: IBM Leads in Quantum Computing, Ford in Driverless Car Patents
value.excerpt: Artificial intelligence, quantum computers and autonomous vehicles are among the fastest-growing areas of technology, with American companies often in the lead, according to a new study of U.S. patents issued over the past five years.
